intro: Volkameria alternifolia, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its alternate, pinnately compound leaves that are often covered in soft, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Volkameria alternifolia is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes and other plants with nitrogen-fixing abilities.
